item.title: Avito Android Infrastructure
item.description: Our engineers working for Avito have made available in open source the entire infrastructure of the company’s Android apps. There you can find: Test framework for UI tests Test runner CI/CD plugins for Android Studio/IntelliJ IDEA Plugin for Android Studio/IntelliJ IDEA for environment checks IDE speed up tips and performance benchmarks And much more. The project comes complete with public documentation, which is actively expanded and updated. Project contributors are available in Telegram chat in both Russian and English.

item.title: Dmitry Voronin
item.description: With Avito since 2014, has been working on CI/CD in Android since 2016.

item.title: Eugene Matsyuk
item.description: Stands up at 5 every morning to works hard on development. Author of popular posts and presentations on development in Android, organizer of meetups, workshops, and academies. Author of the architecture CookBook. One of the authors of the Kaspresso framework. Believes that autotests are the future and the promised land.

item.title: Kaspresso
item.description: Kaspresso is a UI test framework based on Espresso and UI Automator. Developed by Kaspersky. It greatly simplifies writing autotests for Android apps and offers multiple features, where the most important are: 100% stability and reliability Faster execution of Espresso and UI Automator commands. For some commands in the latter, the speed increase is 10x Excellent test readability thanks to a readily comprehensible DSL An incredible interceptor mechanism allowing to intercept all actions and asserts in one place Clear logging Support for ADB calls Autotest writing philosophy and a DSL compliant with this philosophy Fast screenshot tool And much more.

item.title: Workshops
item.description: Over the several years that we have been doing autotests for mobile apps, a great deal of valuable experience has been accumulated. Working on autotests, related tools and infrastructure requires different skills than regular product development of iOS and Android apps. And we want to share our experience and knowledge. We are convinced that this is beneficial for the community and for ourselves. That is why we aim to conduct autotest workshops that anyone can join.
